name: Shisto Pepper
climate: Shisto Peppers thrive in warm, temperate climates with no frost.
They do well where temperatures stay between 18-27°C (65-80°F).
Heavy frost or extreme temperature variations can harm the peppers.
Consistency in temperature greatly enhances plant productivity.
sunlight: These peppers need full sun for at least 6-8 hours a day.
They perform best in sunny locations with minimal shade.
Lack of adequate sunlight can lead to poor fruit production.
Direct sunlight ensures strong plant growth and healthy fruits.
watering: Water the Shisto Pepper plants regularly, maintaining evenly moist soil.
Ensure the soil is not waterlogged as it may cause root rot issues.
During dry spells, increase watering frequency for optimal growth.
Consistent moisture levels will promote better fruit development.
soil: Well-draining soil with plenty of organic matter is ideal for peppers.
The pH level of the soil should be between 6.0 and 6.8 for best results.
Heavy clay soils should be amended with sand or compost to improve drainage.
Regular fertilization, particularly with nitrogen, ensures robust growth.
extra_care_tip: Pruning the plants can enhance airflow and reduce disease risks.
Mulching around the base of plants helps retain soil moisture.
Watch for pests like aphids and use organic methods to control them.
Rotate crop location yearly to minimize soil-borne disease issues.
